channel.title: Supermoto
channel.description:
Anyone know anything about supermoto?
Let's say I wanted a bike that would be suitable as an only/main bike as long as I didn't want to do long motorway stretches, but still suitable for a bit of hooligan fun/LIGHT offroading (street tyres, probably, so just the clear greenlanes in the dry and ... cough... some... other stuff... you all know what I'm talking about)
But without sacrificing TOO much usability as a main bike, obviously I know you're gonna lose stuff, but I mean, I should still be able to take a pillion reasonably comfortably occaisionally, not too much maintenance etc.
What are my options, other than the DRZ400? The DRZ actually looks pretty fucking close to exactly what I want, but I just want to knwo what else is about. Also, I'm worry I might find the DRZ a bit gutless, people have said its pretty weaksauce without mods and I don't have a lot of cash
Thanks bros

item.title: Supermoto
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:13, topic:438041”]thats more like it

edit: and ye yz85, im really tempted by the drz, but i knowww im gonna hate the lack of power… everything with more power is too fucking heavy though which kinda defeats the point[/quote]
Atleast you won’t have to deal with arm pump?

Read full topic

item.title: Supermoto
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

We have a supermoto, they are brilliant, and fast.

CCM 650cc SuperMoto with a Rotax engine and custom exhaust, wheelies in every gear! ha! be careful though, they are rapid.

This isn’t my actual one but it looks pretty much exactly like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Supermoto
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

[quote=“maniown, post:5, topic:438041”]Honda offers two decent (but pricey) dual-sport motorcycles.

http://powersports.honda.com/street/dual-sport.aspx

Depending on how well of a rider you are, the 230F would still do a reasonable speed without taking your head off. As well as handle pretty great off the road.

But the XR650 would be a better long distance driving bike, and less of a off roading bike.[/quote]GZ, you found some fugly bikes.

Read full topic

item.title: Supermoto
item.dc:creator: @maniown maniown
item.description:
@maniown wrote:

Honda offers two decent (but pricey) dual-sport motorcycles.

http://powersports.honda.com/street/dual-sport.aspx

Depending on how well of a rider you are, the 230F would still do a reasonable speed without taking your head off. As well as handle pretty great off the road.

But the XR650 would be a better long distance driving bike, and less of a off roading bike.

Read full topic

item.title: Supermoto
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

I’m confused what you mean by Supermoto. Supermoto is a dirt bike fixed with road slicks to race on road/cross country.

That’s what supermoto is… but I assume you mean a bike such as the Kawasaki KLR’s?

Also; having road just about every form of off-road bike, I can honestly say. If you’re after a bike that’s NOT gutless, do NOT get a DRZ. They all have the grunt of a TTR-80.

Read full topic

item.title: Supermoto
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

the kawasaki klr650 would be the better choice I reckon, it’ll do mud and off-road fine but it’s a “better” road bike

Read full topic
